results.title: The History of inventions
results.creator_credit: Bruno Bozzetto, John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: Bozzetto claims that it was lightning that first showed man the wonders of fire and set him on the hazardous parth of invention. Since primitive times man’s inventive itch has never been at rest; now we find ourselves living on a planet so endangered by our inventions that we may well have to escape to another world to find the peace necessary to go on inventing. In Italian.

results.title: The Historic route
results.creator_credit: Yemi Lijadu and United Nations Films
results.brief_description: Ethiopia has the most remarkable collection of monuments in the whole of Africa apart from the Mediterranean area, and the “historic route” is the richest in the country. The restoration and preservation of monuments as well as the development of sites are essential elements in the growth of tourism in the country’s economy.

results.title: The Highland heart of Nova Scotia
results.creator_credit: Ned Norwood, Margaret Perry and Nova Scotia Information Service
results.brief_description: Outlines history of Cape Breton Island, Nova Scotia highlighting French and Scottish influence on its development. Film depicts traditional music, dancing and crafts and features various places of interest including the Graham Bell Museum, Fort Louisberg, Cabot Trail, etc.

results.title: The Highest court
results.creator_credit: Daryl Dellora, Sue Maslin and Film Art Doco Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: The Highest Court in Australia is an enigma to many. There are sketches of insight which may be attributed to the publicity surrounding cases such as Mabo and Wik, however the mechanisms that have contributed to these decisions are often unknown. This video follows the handing down of two historic judgements; Kruger and Ha, and the appointment of two new Justices. By witnessing these events and processes the viewer is given an informative insight into the High Court and its operation. This documentary is produced by the same individuals who created the title “Mr Neal is entitled to be an agitator” (also in the collection).

results.title: The Heist
results.creator_credit: Rick Rosenberg, Robert W. Christiansen, Stuart Orme, Chris Rose Productions, Home Box Office, Paramount Pictures and Rose Productions
results.brief_description: Produced for television with teleplay by William Irish, Jr, “The Heist” is about revenge with an amusing twist. Neal Skinner (Pierce Brosnan), has served four years in prison for a robbery he did not commit. Believing he had been set up by his business partner, Ebet Berens (Tom Skerritt), he is out to even the score. Skinner finds himself even more determined to bring Berens down when he discovers that his partner has also moved in on his girlfriend Sheila (Wendy Hughes). It becomes a cat and mouse game as Skinner sets out to plan the ultimate heist - to rob the race track and set Berens up at the same time. This is a light-hearted film with a touch of the Remington Steele/James Bond feel played by the ever-suave and charmingly witty Pierce Brosnan in the main role. Cast also includes Noble Willingham, Tom Atkins, and Robert Prosky as Dancer.

results.title: The Heavens are telling
results.brief_description: Part of the BBC Open University television series “From Copernicus to Darwin”. The program begins with Dr Colin Russell’s brief review of the heavens as known to the Babylonian astronomers, and continues with his description of the classical conceptions of the Universe held by the Pythagoreans and Plato, Eudoxus and Aristotle. He then examines the explanation of heavenly motion; discusses the conflict of the pantheistic idea that the heavens themselves were divine, and an alternative idea - that the Universe is a machine whose intricacy and immensity testified to the goodness and glory of God who created it. He finally moves on to Copernicus’ theory of a heliocentric Universe setting the scene for the Copernican revolution.

results.title: The Heart of England
results.creator_credit: Michael Clarke, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: The heart of England lies in the Cotswold country. The changes in the seasons bring to this area are seen first in early spring, with the harrowing of the rich fields, the first buds on the trees, the blossoming orchards. Later comes the Three Counties Show at Hereford, cricket at Cheltenham on the village green, and finally the harvest and the traditional fairs.

results.title: The Haunting of Barney Palmer
results.brief_description: Barney Palmer was eight years old when his haunting began, Whispers in the waves, images in the mirror, voices in his dreams. Is it the ghost of his great Uncle Barnaby or is it the ghost of somebody not yet dead? Someone, somewhere in this world or in the next is promising to carry him away. For Barney, the answer lies close within the strength of his home.

results.brief_description: An animated film which presents an adaptation of Oscar Wilde’s story of “The Happy Prince”. Narrated by Christopher Plummer and Glynis Johns.

results.title: The Ham artist = The Face on the bar room floor [SOUND]
results.creator_credit: Charles Chaplin, Mack Sennett, Mack Sennett Comedies and W H Productions
results.brief_description: A burlesque of the famous poem by Hugh Antoine D’Arcy of the broken-down artist who, having lost his wife to another man, draws her face on the floor and then passes out, drunk. Sound version with piano accompaniament.
